definitions.dating_raw: Attested from around (1150 to 1350) until the late 16 century.
Attested from around (1350 to 1470) until the late 19 century.
Attested from around (1350 to 1470) until the late 15 century.

definitions.definition: To give power to; to reinforce; to confirm.
definitions.dating_raw: Attested from around (1350 to 1470) until the mid 17 century.
Attested from the late 16 century until the early 17 century.

definitions.definition: present participle and gerund of can
examples: I might be able to go.
I have been able to go, since I was seven.
I had been able to go before.
I will be able to go tomorrow.

main_definition: ( transitive , obsolete ) To make ready. [Attested from around (1150 to 1350) until the late 16 century.]
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , obsolete ) To make capable; to enable . [Attested from around (1350 to 1470) until the late 19 century.]
( transitive , obsolete ) To dress. [Attested from around (1350 to 1470) until the late 15 century.]
( transitive , obsolete ) To give power to; to reinforce; to confirm. [Attested from around (1350 to 1470) until the mid 17 century.]
( transitive , obsolete ) To vouch for ; to guarantee. [Attested from the late 16 century until the early 17 century.]
present participle and gerund of can
